--- Robert Riley <chiyohakuryuu@...> wrote:

> Malice:
> 
> The mortar blast knocked him back, but he stepped back to his
> position in front of Myrmidon. Before the smoke cleared, he swung
> his chain sword at Myrmidon and fired at perceptor with his rifle. 
> When the smoke thinned enough, one could see the damage visibly
> repairing itself.
> 
> "Heh, that felt kinda good.  Do it again, it might tickle."

As soon as the motar blast knocked Malice back Myrmidon sprang into
action! He knew Malice to be a more formidable fighter than he had let
on . . . but then again so was Myrmidon. Myrmidon had only hit him with
enough force to set him back, testing the durability of this opponant.
The fact that Malice had been able to absorb the energy from the
shielding was not lost on him as he moved to the side, the swooshing
noise from inside the smoke told him that swinging. Switching to
tracking sensors allowed him to pierce the smoke as if it wasn't there,
and see the comming attack . . . 

**CLANG!!**

. . . With graceful movements Myrmidon dodged underneath the rather
clumsy swing of the chain sword, the last of it bouncing of his sword. 

The sword he used bore a rather disturbing resemblance to a klingon
batleth as he swung it through the air, (not that TF's would know a
batleth from a hand grenade but hey!) As Myrmidon brought it around
pinned to his arm he deflected that last of Malice's attack, swinging
it back around and up!
 
As Myrmidon came back to a ready stance he could clearly see Malice's
healing and was not in the slightest bit impressed. Malice was not the
only one with that ability, Myrmidon was designed to . . . to . . . it
still eluded him.

Without a pause he continued to swing, so that as Malice stepped foward
to say something foolish sounding, but it was not Myrmidon's face he
met, but the jutting edge of his blade!

Preston
(Myrmidon)
